abstract.p: Letter from Clifford E Douglas (Tobacco Control Law and Policy Consulting), commenting on May 23 article, says tobacco companies do not acknowledge that cigarettes are a dangerous product

block.p: You report that tobacco manufacturers say they now recognize that cigarettes are a dangerous product (news article, May 23).
You report that tobacco manufacturers say they now recognize that cigarettes are a dangerous product (news article, May 23).

However, a careful look at the industry's public statements discloses that they only acknowledge that medical authorities -- but not the companies themselves -- believe that smoking causes cancer and heart disease.

They now admit that smoking is ''addictive,'' but only in the sense that the term is ''commonly understood'' by the average layperson. Not one tobacco industry executive has yet conceded that nicotine causes a physical drug dependency as powerful as addiction to heroin and cocaine.
It is unlikely that they will truly change unless a sizable punitive damage award forces them to do so.
CLIFFORD E. DOUGLAS Ann Arbor, Mich., May 23, 2000
The writer is president, Tobacco Control Law and Policy Consulting.
